name: Fishin' with the Homies
description:
Story

You are a fisherman who is just interested in luring in some nice catches. However, you discover there are other things in these waters besides fish. After fishing up different body parts, you realize you can fit them together to build a homunculus to help you catch fish more often. What other kinds of lakes are out there and where do these mysterious parts come from?

Controls

  • WASD - Move / Fight Fish (Only when a fish is on your hook)
  • Left Click - Cast / Interact with menues
  • Left Click (Hold) - Charge Cast/Reel (if the bobber is in water)
  • Right Click - End Case (Only works if there isn't something on your hook)
  • E - Advance Dialogue
  • Tab / I - Open you inventory
  • Esc - Open the pause menu

This build was submitted on May 12, 2022, and the game is currently in progress. This is a game the team and I made for the 2nd of a 3-course sequence in the Senior Capstone and that was continued through the 3rd course. We began this project in September 2021.

Team Members and some of their Accomplishments (not limited to)

  • Steve Jester - Project Manager
  • Justine Bader - UI Artist
  • Ryan Martin - Modeler/Animator
  • Alex Kauble - Narrative/Dialogue Designer
  • Adam Larson - Level Designer
  • Nicholas Richer - Audio Designer
  • Jacob Kaplan - Gameplay Programmer
  • Michael "Chris" Trimbach - Gameplay / Systems Programmer
